info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 2:02AM CDT until April 05 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN AND PARTS OF THE CENTRAL TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 9 PM CDT this evening. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Texas. In Texas...Sherman. * 20 Foot Winds...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 6. * Timing...Noon through 9 PM CDT Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
